msItem.title: Latin deed with Hebrew quitclaim and note

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 1; ruled lines: 14 47; written lines: 14 47; The Hebrew text written on the back of the Latin charter. Three strips of vellum attached at the bottom (for the currently missing seals).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Latin and Hebrew Ashkenazi semi-cursive script of the 13th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: William Petty (formerly Fitzmaurice) (b. 1737, d. 1805), 2nd earl of Shelburne and 1st marquess of Lansdowne, prime minister; purchased by the British Museum together with 1244 other Lansdowne manuscripts in 1807.
